messageBody:
> I'm
> curious how you'd choose to refactor this, what tests you
> would need to add, a comparison of the amount of code and
> number of classes a developer would have to sift through to
> understand the this vs. your ideal implementation.

I only skimmed over it, but it looked to me as if the private methods
weren't overly complex, so they probably didn't need their own tests.
Therefore I'd likely just leave the code alone.

What I said was that I see private methods *that need explicite testing* as
a smell. In those cases my *first* look would be at wether the design can
benefit from moving the method. I didn't even say that I'd always do it,
just that I can't remember an instance where there design didn't improve
when I did.

Hope this explains my view a little bit better...

Cheers, Ilja
